G

GameFrame - Class in a11rallypong
The GameFrame class is responsible for creating a Frame for the pong game to be rendered in.
GameFrame() - Constructor for class a11rallypong.GameFrame
Create the Frame.
GameOver() - Method in class a11rallypong.base
The GameOver method is called once the while loop in the run method is finished (aka when the game is over).
GameOverGUI - Class in a11rallypong
The GameOverGUI class creates a GUI for the user to submit their score to the save file of scores or quit the game without saving it.
GameOverGUI() - Constructor for class a11rallypong.GameOverGUI
Create the application.
getAScore(ArrayList<score>, int) - Method in class a11rallypong.HighScoresGUI
The getAScore method pulls a score object out of the list of scores according to the location specified
getHitcount() - Method in class a11rallypong.base
The getHitcount method is a getter that returns the current hitcount of the object.
getScore() - Method in class a11rallypong.score
getScore is a getter that returns the value of the score saved in the object.
getScreenTotalArea(Window) - Static method in class a11rallypong.DrawHere
The getScreenTotalArea method finds the size of the users screen so that the game can be fullscreen on any screen size and the play area will adapt to this size.
getScreenTotalArea(Window) - Static method in class a11rallypong.GameOverGUI
The getScreenTotalArea method finds the size of the users screen so that the game can be full screen on any screen size and the play area will adapt to this size.
getScreenTotalArea(Window) - Static method in class a11rallypong.HighScoresGUI
The getScreenTotalArea method finds the size of the users screen so that the game can be fullscreen on any screen size and the play area will adapt to this size.
getScreenTotalArea(Window) - Static method in class a11rallypong.MainMenuGUI
The getScreenTotalArea method finds the size of the users screen so that the game can be fullscreen on any screen size and the play area will adapt to this size.
getVels() - Method in class a11rallypong.ball
getVels sets the dx and dy of the ball when it is instantiated by calling their assigned methods.
